intro: Veronica myosotoides, commonly known as the blueweed or mouse-ear veronica, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is a popular choice for gardeners seeking a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
